msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Amount of 600 drachmas written on Verso
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 4171; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides; almost regularly cut at the top. Kollesis is at the middle of the papyrus. There are some lacunae and damage: at the middle of col. 103 as result of a fold, at the middle of the papyrus and at the middle of col. 104. The bottom is irregularly cut. Some letters are survived in the last line of the column. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. In a few cases the scribe separated a new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer. The scribe wrote some words on the verso, presumably as a draft.
